The city averaged <h8>`r prettyNum(round(assaults_city$last12mos/52,0), big.mark=",")`</h8> assaults a week over the last 12 months. In 2019, that number was <h8>`r prettyNum(round(assaults_city$total19/52,0), big.mark=",")`</h8> a week.

<subhead>A closer look at Houston assaults neighborhood by neighborhood</subhead>

The danger is not the same neighborhood to neighborhood. ABC13's data team looked at the Houston Police Department's data by neighborhood from 2019 through `r format(asofdate, "%B %d")`.

The map color-codes each neighborhood by the assault rate over the last 12 months. The three darker blues represent neighborhoods with assault rates that are higher than the citywide rate. You can also click the box in the bottom right corner to see neighborhoods by the number of assaults.

Click on any neighborhood on the map to see detailed numbers, rates and trends. You can also search for a street name, place, landmark or zip code.

<br>

```{r cars, echo=FALSE,out.width='100%',out.height='600'}
# assault MAP
# Set bins for numbers of crimes for assaults map
assaultbins1 <- c(0,
                2000,
                3000,
                5000,
                7500,
                10000)
assaultbins2 <- c(0,
                200,
                500,
                750,
                1000,
                2000)
assaultpal1 <- colorBin(c("#99a0a5",
                             "#2787d6",
                             "#0058f6",
                             "#003ca6",
                             "#00215c"), assaults_beat$rate_last12, bins = assaultbins1,na.color = "#51585f")

assaultpal2 <- colorBin(c("#99a0a5",
                             "#2787d6",
                             "#0058f6",
                             "#003ca6",
                             "#00215c"), assaults_beat$last12mos, bins = assaultbins2,na.color = "#51585f")


# Create quick labels for assaults map
assaultlabel <- paste(sep="",
                     "<popuptitle>",
                     prettyNum(assaults_beat$last12mos, big.mark=","),

                     assaults_beat$placename,

                     prettyNum(assaults_beat$population, big.mark=","),
                     " people.

# Creating police beats map for types of crimes
houston_assault_map <- leaflet(assaults_beat, options = leafletOptions(zoomControl = FALSE, zoomSnap = 0.5, zoomDelta=0.5)) %>%
  htmlwidgets::onRender("function(el, x) {
L.control.zoom({ position: 'topright' }).addTo(this)
}") %>%
  setView(-95.45, 29.75, zoom = 10.5) %>% 
  addProviderTiles(provider = "CartoDB.Positron") %>%
  addPolygons(color = "white", 
              popup = assaultlabel,
              popupOptions = popupOptions(maxWidth ="200", 
                                          minWidth ="200"),
              weight = 2, 
              smoothFactor = 0.5,
              opacity = 0.6, 
              fillOpacity = 0.6,
              fillColor = ~assaultpal1(rate_last12),
              group="Rate") %>% 
    addPolygons(color = "white", 
              popup = assaultlabel,
              popupOptions = popupOptions(maxWidth ="200", 
                                          minWidth ="200"),
              weight = 2, 
              smoothFactor = 0.5,
              opacity = 0.6, 
              fillOpacity = 0.6,
              fillColor = ~assaultpal2(last12mos),
              group="Number") %>% 
  addSearchOSM(options = searchOptions(autoCollapse=FALSE, minLength = 3,zoom=13, position="topleft")) %>%
    onRender("function(el, x) {
        $('input.search-input')[0].placeholder = 'Search street, place or zip code'
        }") %>%
  addLegend(opacity = 0.6,
            values = assaults_beat$rate_last12, 
            pal = assaultpal1,
            position = "bottomleft", 
            title = paste(sep="","<popuptitle>Assault Rate<br><popupchatter>Assaults/100K people<br>Citywide: ",prettyNum(round(assaults_city$rate_last12,0), big.mark=",")),
            group = "Rate",
            className = "info legend Rate") %>%
  addLegend(opacity = 0.6,
            values = assaults_beat$last12mos, 
            pal = assaultpal2,
            position = "bottomleft", 
            title = paste(sep="","<popuptitle>Assaults<br><popupchatter>Total assaults<br>Citywide: ",prettyNum(round(assaults_city$last12mos,0), big.mark=",")),
            group = "Number",
            className = "info legend Number") %>%
  addLayersControl(
    baseGroups = c("Rate","Number"),
    options = layersControlOptions(collapsed = FALSE),
    position = 'bottomright') %>% hideGroup(c("Number")) %>%
   htmlwidgets::onRender("
      function(el, x) {
         var updateLegend = function () {
            var selectedGroup = document.querySelectorAll('input:checked')[0].nextSibling.innerText.substr(1);

            document.querySelectorAll('.legend').forEach(a => a.hidden=true);
            document.querySelectorAll('.legend').forEach(l => {
               if (l.classList.contains(selectedGroup)) l.hidden=false;
            });
         };
         updateLegend();
         this.on('baselayerchange', el => updateLegend());
      }"
   )
houston_assault_map
```
